archetype_name: Family Weekend Advanced: South African Braai & Potjie
name: T-Bone Steak Braai with Garlic Herb Butter, Tomato-Onion Smoor, and Fire-Toasted Rolls
description: Reverse-seared T-bone steaks finished over hot coals, topped with garlic herb butter, with a classic tomato-onion smoor and charred bread rolls for mopping up.
prep_steps: Light a wood or charcoal fire for a two-zone braai; aim for a hot direct side and a cooler indirect side. Preheat oven to 120°C (250°F).
Pat dry T-bone steaks and season on all sides with salt, black pepper, and braai spice mix. Rub lightly with olive oil.
Set out garlic herb butter to soften at room temperature.
If using rosemary, rinse and pat dry sprigs.
cook_steps: Reverse-sear start: Place seasoned T-bone steaks on a wire rack over a tray and cook in the 120°C oven until internal temp reaches 46–48°C (about 35–45 minutes, depending on thickness).
Start the smoor: Set a braai-safe pot or stovetop pan over medium heat (braai indirect heat or stove). Add sunflower oil, then onions. Cook 8–10 minutes, stirring, until soft and lightly golden.

Add tomatoes, tomato paste, a pinch of salt and black pepper, chilli flakes, a splash of apple cider vinegar, and a pinch of brown sugar. Simmer 15–20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thick and jammy. Adjust seasoning to taste; keep warm.

Finish steaks over coals: Move steaks to the hot direct side of the grill (add rosemary to the coals for aroma if using). Sear 2–3 minutes per side, plus sear the fat edge, until deep crust forms and internal temp is 52–55°C for medium-rare (cook longer for preferred doneness).
Rest steaks 8–10 minutes on a warm plate. Top with slices of garlic herb butter to melt.
Grill bread rolls cut-side down over direct heat 30–60 seconds until charred at the edges.
Carve steaks by cutting out the fillet and strip from the bone, slice thickly, and return slices to the bone for serving. Serve with warm smoor and fire-toasted rolls.
